ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.2_0: At that time there was a female lay follower Kāṇamātā who had faith and confidence.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.3_0: when a man has given to an inhabited area,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.4_0: On one occasion Kāṇā went to her mother’s house on some business.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.5_0: Kāṇā’s husband sent her the same message, and everything unfolded as before.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.6_0: Kāṇamātā thought, “It’s shameful to go empty-handed,” and she baked pastries.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.7_0: When the pastries were finished, an alms-collecting monk entered Kāṇamātā’s house.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.8_0: And the same happened a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.9_0: And the same happened a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.10_0: At that, all the pastries were gone.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.11_0: A second time Kāṇā’s husband sent her the same message, and everything unfolded as before.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.12_0: A second time Kāṇamātā thought, “It’s shameful to go empty-handed,” and she baked pastries.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.13_0: When the pastries were finished, an alms-collecting monk entered Kāṇamātā’s house.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.15_0: And the same happened a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.16_0: And the same happened a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.17_0: At that, all the pastries were gone.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.18_0: A third time he sent the same message,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.19_0: adding, “If Kāṇā doesn’t come, I’ll find another wife.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.20_0: But once again all the pastries were given to monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.21_0: When the pastries were finished, an alms-collecting monk entered Kāṇamātā’s house.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.23_0: And the same happened a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.24_0: And the same happened a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.25_0: At that, all the pastries were gone.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.26_0: Then he ordered another wife to make another wife.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.27_0: and when Kāṇā heard what had happened, she cried.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.28_0: Soon afterwards, after robing up in the morning, the Buddha took his bowl and robe and went to Kāṇamātā’s house.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.28_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.30_0: The Buddha said to Kāṇamātā, “Why have you come?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.30_1: Kāṇamātā told the Buddha what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.1.31_0: After instructing, inspiring, and gladdening her with a teaching, the Buddha got up from his seat and left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.1_0: Soon afterwards a certain caravan was ready to go south from Rājagaha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.2_0: An alms-collecting monk approached that caravan to get almsfood,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.3_0: the devotee had given to that monk, (saying):
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.4_0: And the same happened a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.5_0: And the same happened a third time.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.6_0: At that, all the flour was gone.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.7_0: That lay follower said to the other people in the caravan,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.8_0: “Sirs, please wait one day. I’ve given my provisions to the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.9_0: and I need to prepare more provisions.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.10_0: “We can’t wait; the caravan is going already.” And they left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.11_0: After preparing provisions, that lay follower followed after the caravan, but he was robbed by thieves.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.12_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.13_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics receive without moderation?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.14_0: This man gave to them, and then because he was following after the caravan he was robbed by thieves.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.15_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.17_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.18_0: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.19_0: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of well-behaved monks, for the restraint of corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.20_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.21.1_0: ‘If a monk approaches a family and is invited to take pastries or baked goods, he may accept two or three bowlfuls if he wishes. If he accepts more than that, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:1.2.22_0: If he accepts two or three bowlfuls, he should take it away and share it with the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.2_0: a family: there are four kinds of family: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.6_0: whatever has been prepared for the purpose of sending away.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.8_0: whatever has been prepared for the purpose of crossing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.10_0: saying, “Take as much as you like.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.13_0: He may accept two or three bowlfuls:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.14_0: two or three bowlfuls can be accepted.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.15_0: If he accepts more than that:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.16_0: if he receives more than that, commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.17_0: If he accepts two or three bowlfuls:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.18_0: leaving that place and seeing a monk, he should tell him, “I’ve accepted two or three bowlfuls from such-and-such a place; don’t receive anything from there.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.19_0: If he sees a monk, but does not tell him, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.20_0: If one who is told accepts from there regardless, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.21_0: He should expel them with the monks, and share them with the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.1.22_0: he should take it away when he is returning from almsround and then share it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.1_0: If it is more than two or three bowlfuls, and he perceives it as more, and he receives it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.2_0: If it is more than two or three bowlfuls, but he is unsure of it, and he receives it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.3_0: If it is more than two or three bowlfuls, but he perceives it as less, and he receives it, he commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.4_0: If it is less than two or three bowlfuls, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.5_0: If it is less than two or three bowlfuls, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.2.6_0: If it is less than two or three bowlfuls, and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.2_0: if he accepts two or three bowlfuls;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.3_0: if he accepts less than two or three bowlfuls;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.4_0: if they give anything that has not been prepared for sending away or for provisions for a journey;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.5_0: if they give the leftovers from what was prepared for sending away or for provisions for a journey;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.6_0: if they give after the plans to travel have been canceled;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.9_0: if it is built for someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.10_0: if it is by means of her own property;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.12_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pc34:2.3.13_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on Kāṇamātā, is finished.
